channel.title: AMD SOUTHERN ISLAND and NVIDIA KEPLER
channel.description: Does anybody know something about the next gpu´s from amd and nvidia? i´ve only got some rumours that amd southern island will be the 6000 series but in 28nm and will be released after july/august.

item.title: AMD SOUTHERN ISLAND and NVIDIA KEPLER
item.dc:creator: King_Kaddo
item.description:
no. Larrabee is a multicore processor with x86 design. Has nothing to do with traditional gpu design.

Read full topic
item.source: AMD SOUTHERN ISLAND and NVIDIA KEPLER

item.title: AMD SOUTHERN ISLAND and NVIDIA KEPLER
item.dc:creator: Texter
item.description:
A whole new AMD architecture on tech sites. Funny that it looks like a response to Larrabee and not necessarily Fermi lol.

Read full topic
item.source: AMD SOUTHERN ISLAND and NVIDIA KEPLER

item.title: AMD SOUTHERN ISLAND and NVIDIA KEPLER
item.dc:creator: King_Kaddo
item.description:
finger:

i´ve only got some rumours that amd southern island will be the 6000 series but in 28nm.

WROOONG.

Southern Island will be a whole new architecture. Amd will use SIMDs instead of VLIWs. The gpu will be optimized for gpu computation.
I have no idea of Kepler.

Read full topic
item.source: AMD SOUTHERN ISLAND and NVIDIA KEPLER
